New Records: Shaheen Shah Afridi conceded only 24 off his four overs
Key Match Events: Finn Allen was given out lbw off his second and successfully reviewed, but when he was lbw again off his third, no review could save him
Devon Conway run out courtesy of a direct hit from Shadab Khan at mid-off
Pakistan’s spinners proceeded to suck the life out of New Zealand’s innings
Daryl Mitchell dragged his side to a vaguely defendable total of 152 for four with an unbeaten 53 off 35
Both Pakistan openers went on to score half-centuries
Shan Masood scored a single off the next ball to finish it
Post-Match Reflections: This was the 12th time New Zealand have reached the final four of a global tournament, but they are yet to lift a trophy
Credit to Pakistan, they were too good today and we weren’t quite at our best
At the halfway stage we felt we had something to defend [but] Pakistan were outstanding with the bat and they ran that down with ease
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan booked their place in Sunday’s final courtesy of a seven-wicket win over New Zealand
Pakistan dominated from the third ball of the night
New Zealand's bowler-heavy team is designed to defend such totals, but a ragged performance in the field destroyed their chances
Others: Saqlain Mushtaq’s mystical charm inspires Pakistan to triumph through instinct
